summary: ANIMEXIS — a cinematic, dark-mode, scroll-driven web experience that presents anime as emotion/motion (no clips, spoilers, or clutter). Includes a landing page with ambient motion and a main vertical full-screen anime gallery where each anime has a 200-word cinematic summary, poster/hero image, color+motion identity, and a looping abstract animation.
architectural_notes: Tech stack direction: Next.js/React frontend with Tailwind CSS and Framer Motion; animations via CSS/SVG minimum with optional Canvas/WebGL/Three.js.
Design constraints: no episode clips, no spoilers, no clutter; dark-mode only; scroll-driven storytelling.
Data model per anime: title, ~200-word cinematic summary, poster URL, color palette, animation preset; designed to scale to 100+ entries.
Footer attribution requirement changed: remove caffeine.ai attribution (“Built with love using caffeine.ai”) and replace with “Copyright 2026 ANIMEXIS” plus creator credit text.
Landing page requirement change: remove the “Scroll to Enter” prompt / scroll-gated entry; use a normal landing experience instead.
known_issues: Potential conflict: earlier requirement said to keep the existing caffeine.ai link/UTM parameters; user now requests removing it.
Frontend shows error: "failed to load anime data" (likely backend API/data fetch failure).

existing_features.title: Create a Landing page (route: "/") that acts as an emotional hook: near-black dark background with a subtle grain look, slow animated gradient fog, a title that fades in letter-by-letter, and a “Scroll to Enter” prompt with no clickable button UI.
Implement ambient landing animations: floating particles and subtle parallax depth that respond gently to cursor/touch/scroll, maintaining an ambient, non-distracting feel.

Create an Anime Gallery page (route: "/gallery") as the main experience: a vertical cinematic scroll where each anime is a full-screen section; each section includes an abstract animation canvas on the left/center and the anime title + ~200-word cinematic summary on the right/bottom; background uses a genre-based color theme; sections reveal smoothly on scroll with no hard cuts.

Define and enforce a global UI system: dark-mode only; glassmorphism blur panels for text content; cinematic typography pairing (distinct title vs body); ease-in-out motion defaults; hover interactions that produce a soft glow; scroll should feel like “story progression”. Also add one coherent visual theme (color tokens, type scale, spacing, shadows) and apply it consistently across the landing + gallery.

Implement an abstract looping animation system with named presets (e.g., energy waves, particle fields, ink splashes, glitch distortion, soft liquid gradients, light streaks, grain/blur layers). Each anime entry must reference exactly one preset; animations must be non-literal (no scene recreation) and loop seamlessly.

Create a scalable content/data model for anime entries with fields: title, ~200-word spoiler-free cinematic summary, poster URL (or static asset path), color palette, animation preset, and genre/category. Seed the app with the provided 30 anime list and ensure it can scale to 100+ entries without changing the UI architecture.

Performance and responsiveness: lazy-load poster images, avoid video autoplay entirely, target smooth 60fps-feeling motion, use GPU-friendly transforms, and provide a mobile-responsive layout with simplified animations (reduced particle density/effects) and respect user “reduced motion” preferences.
Add required generated static images to the project and render them as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images through the backend).
Add a visible creator credit line with the exact text “Created by R. Ashwath Reddy” to the app UI (user-facing, English text).

Update the existing footer attribution block to include the creator credit alongside the current copyright/“Built with … caffeine.ai” text, without removing the existing caffeine.ai link or its UTM parameters.

Update the app footer attribution block to remove the entire “Built with love/❤️ using caffeine.ai” text and remove the caffeine.ai link completely, and instead display exactly: “Copyright 2026 ANIMEXIS”.
Update the footer creator credit line to display exactly: “Created by Ashwath”.
Remove the “Scroll to Enter” UI from the landing page so it is no longer rendered.
Remove the scroll/touch-driven navigation gating on the landing page and make the app open in a normal way (no requirement to scroll/touch to enter the gallery).

Harden the frontend anime list query so that it does not get stuck in a permanent error state for recoverable backend initialization issues: keep the existing error text “Failed to load anime data”, but ensure the query attempts the existing initialize-then-refetch flow only when the backend successfully returns an empty list (not when the call fails/rejects).
Make the app open on a dedicated title page at route "/" that prominently displays the project/app name and the owner name, in English.
Update the existing letter-by-letter title component to support rendering both the app name and an owner-name line (subtitle or secondary line) as part of the title-page hero content.
Provide a clear, non-scroll-gated way to proceed from the title page to the existing gallery page ("/gallery") without reintroducing scroll-to-enter gating.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build Landing Page with dark grain background, animated gradient fog, letter-by-letter title reveal, and 'Scroll to Enter' prompt (no buttons); ambient particles/parallax.

Build Anime Gallery main experience: vertical cinematic scroll with full-screen sections; abstract animation canvas + anime name and ~200-word summary; genre-based background themes; smooth scroll reveals.
Implement global UI system: dark-mode only, glassmorphism/blur panels, cinematic typography, ease-in-out motion, hover glow interactions, scroll-driven progression.

Create abstract looping animation system per anime (non-literal): presets like energy waves, particles, ink, glitch, liquid gradients, light streaks, grain/blur; built with CSS/SVG/Framer Motion and optional Canvas/WebGL/Three.js.
Create scalable content/data model for anime entries (title, 200-word summary, poster URL, color palette, animation preset) seeded with the provided 30+ anime list; support growth to 100+ items.
Performance & responsiveness requirements: lazy-load/optimize posters, no video autoplay, target 60fps with GPU-friendly effects, mobile-responsive with simplified animations.

Implement backend APIs in the single Motoko main actor to serve anime data to the frontend: list all anime, get anime by id/slug, and expose a simple version/info method for debugging. Persist the seeded dataset in stable state so it survives canister upgrades.
Add a creator credit line displaying “Created by R. Ashwath Reddy” (e.g., on the landing page and/or persistent footer).
Update footer attribution: remove the “Built with love using caffeine.ai” text/link and replace with “Copyright 2026 ANIMEXIS” plus a creator credit line (“Created by Ashwath”).
Update landing page UX to remove the “Scroll to Enter” prompt and make the entry/hero behavior “normal” (no scroll-to-enter gating).

Fix the backend anime data source so the frontend call `actor.getAllAnime()` succeeds and returns a non-empty list after initialization. Ensure the backend exposes a `getAllAnime` method matching the frontend expectation in `frontend/src/hooks/useAnimeList.ts`, and ensure `initialize()` actually persists the seeded anime entries so subsequent `getAllAnime()` calls return them.
Add a title page that prominently features the project/app name and the owner name (creator).
